ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: good course to map theory to papers.

I would probably recommend going and prioritizing the time spent. It is worthwhile to read in advance article with methods that could be used in the future, and it's probably not too bad to invest less in lesson that aren't as relevant for future work

Course is very fragmented. The three components do not fit together. There is no homework, so there is no incentive to keep up with readings or to try to understand the (very complicated) papers. The course needs to do better with teaching students how to use econometrics. Only take if required for your programotherwise, there are better ways to learn econometrics.

I would only recommend this course to students in the econ department who need to fulfill the second year econometrics paper requirement. It is a useless course otherwise. But it does not have to be this way. If the course were adjusted to cover more standard material and have more assignments in which students could practice applying the topics covered in class (even if these assignments are not graded), that would improve the course. Asking professors to teach the course who actually know how to and care about teaching would be an easy way to improve the course, though from what I have seen, these skills are neither valued nor encouraged by either the department or the university itself.

Somewhat useful. The course would benefit from giving small, non intensive, practical homework assignments of the sort of download this data set & apply the technique we just discussed. Would make learning much more effective.
Focus on areas that will help you in future work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Introduced me to good papers in areas of interest.
Mostly the examples were useful to show what methods are used in practice
1st and 3rd thirds: this course did not add to my knowledge 2nd third: I feel that I have a better understanding of the connection between various methods/models
For the advanced topics, I do not think we went deep enough. For the easy topics, it reinforced what I already knew.
